abstract: The company announced a move that, if completed, would be a sharp rebuke of the strategy of the former chief executive Robert L. Nardelli.
snippet: The company announced a move that, if completed, would be a sharp rebuke of the strategy of the former chief executive Robert L. Nardelli.
lead_paragraph: Shortly after Robert L. Nardelli was deposed as chief executive of Home Depot, several of the country’s biggest buyout firms welcomed the company’s new leader, Frank Blake, with a tantalizing proposal, according to people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Home Depot May Shed Unit to Focus on Retail
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Supply Unit May Be Sold

byline.original: By Michael Barbaro and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: A recent offer by the country’s biggest buyout firms to take Home Depot‘s wholesale supply division off Frank Blake’s hands was apparently the spark that lit the flame. The New York Times reports that shortly after Robert L. Nardelli was deposed as chief executive of Home Depot, several private equity firms told Mr. Blake, the company’s new leader, that they would consider buying the retailer’s $12 billion wholesale business.
lead_paragraph: A recent offer by the country’s biggest buyout firms to take Home Depot‘s wholesale supply division off Frank Blake’s hands was apparently the spark that lit the flame. The New York Times reports that shortly after Robert L. Nardelli was deposed as chief executive of Home Depot, several private equity firms told Mr. Blake, the company’s new leader, that they would consider buying the retailer’s $12 billion wholesale business.

headline.main: Buyout Shops Made Home Depot an Offer It Couldn’t Refuse
